column4: I've run into the most bizarre problem, I get permission denied when ever I try to modify any files in my home directory.
But ls -l shows that the owner is set to my user, and that I should have write access.
try   ls -la   in a terminal to see who owns the files
It has my user all over it, and I've done a chown -R just to be sure. Still permission denied.
chmod a+wrx still returns "permission denied" when I try to modify the file.
the only other thing I can think of is if it a separate partition it might be mounted readonly
One sec, I have a weird mount attached to the home directory, looks like ecryptfs might be messing with it.
After seven years of Debian SID, you kinda get use to this stuff happening.
Thank you for the help, wouldn't have caught that mount if you didn't mention it.
